oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FLUSHING BEHAVIOUR OF A COASTAL MARINA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schwartz, R.A.
Imberger, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: flushing
marina
marina flushing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The flushing characteristics of a newly constructed marina were determined from a comprehensive field study which included a dye dilution experiment together with measurements of barotropic and baroclinic forcing parameters. The results to be presented show that the major exchange process in this particular marina is a baroclinic circulation, and that the exchange rate is controlled by the harbour entrance geometry.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 195
